name: Fullstar Vegetable Chopper - Food Chopper - Onion Chopper - Vegetable Slicer & Spiralizer - Veggie Chopper with Container - Kitchen Gadgets - Home Essentials - Kitchen Accessories (4 in 1, White)
about_this_item: The Original Pro Chopper - Our superstar veggie slicer has been creating waves on TikTok! Simple to use, set up, and clean, save time and energy during meal prep with our OG vegetable chopper. Chop, slice, and dice your ingredients like a seasoned chef!

Easy Meal Prep with Rust-Resistant Blades - Our vegetable chopper is perfect for anyone who wants to eat healthier but doesn't have a lot of time to spare. Dice potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, and more with the heavy-duty, rust-resistant blades. The 420 stainless steel blades retain razor sharpness for crisp, smooth dicing.

5-Star Design - With a soft grip handle made of long-lasting TPU, you'll enjoy more control over your chopping motions. The non-skid rubberized bottom of this BPA-free veggie chopper will keep it firmly in place on any surface, wet or dry.

No mess and slips - our catch tray makes cooking so much more convenient, no mess and no messing around! It makes cleaning effortless and our non-slip base also makes your chopping that much easier. Plus the entire chopper is dishwasher-safe (top rack) .

A Kitchen Essential - Whether you're a novice cook or a seasoned pro, the Fullstar Food Chopper is a must-have in any kitchen. It's versatile and easy to use. Please read the instruction manual provided with the Fullstar food chopper closely before use.

title: Game Changer
content: This little chopper has made food prep so much easier. It's ability to dice onions alone makes it worth it. But it also works on bell peppers, celery, cabbage, apples, and zucchini. It works on carrots too but only a couple of small pieces at a time and it takes a little more oomph. It works on the bulb of green onions but not the soft green tops. It does not work on green beans, and I didn't try it on broccoli because I think it would be a pain to clean. All of the other vegetables are easy to clean out of it. It comes with a brush to scrape the blades and a fork thing to clean the top. The top was a pain to scrape, but I really only need to do it once when I'm all finished. The chopper was smaller than I expected, but that actually works in my tiny kitchen. I just need to cut veggies into smaller pieces, but I still think it cut down veggie prep time by half. It's also just fun to use. I was almost sad the first time I used it because I ran out of veggies to chop. Time will tell if it holds up and worth the full price, but so far it's worth the sale price I was lucky enough to pay.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I bought this bc we were having a party and I didn't want to cut onions for hours. I set aside like 3 hours for prepping veggies and was done in like 20-30 mins. I've used it on onions, cucumber, tomato, zucchini, squash, lettuce. Pretty much all the common salad veggies and it's been great. My husband hates prep work but now he's like raring to go to use this thing it's so easy. The little box is decent sized and will hold a decent amount. I got one with two dicer blades and both work great. They are very sharp tho! Only pick up by the plastic lip. I learned that the hard way. It seems like it will last. We've been using it a few times a week for about a month now. I wash it top rack in the dishwasher no problem. It did come with little cleaning brush thing and a device to get any veggies out that get stuck in the blade but I haven't needed them.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2024

title: My husband loves this
content: This food chopper does an excellent job at cutting vegetables.  It's sturdy, made of quality materials, and comes with a assortment of tools.  I have been using this chopper to cut a variety of vegetables and have not been disappointed so far.  It's best to chop firm vegetables, e.g., onions, zucchini, etc.  Soft vegetables like ripe tomatoes, may not cut very well.  Another drawback is that the blades are difficult to clean -- food can get stuck between the blades.  I've attached 2 photos showing what remains after rinsing the blades when an onion and tomato were cut.  Also, if you're not careful, you may cut your fingers trying to clean the crevices.  The chopper in fact, cautions users to "never touch blades with your fingers."  Getting the blades completely clean for example, when you want to store the cutter for a long time, may be painstakingly slow.  Finally, much downward pressure may be needed to cut firm vegetables -- this may be an issue for those with arthritis, pain in their limbs, or who are physically weak.  Overall, it's a great chopper and highly recommended to all.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I love chopped salads but lack the patience to cut everything up with a knife.  This makes it faster, easier and fun.  I just throw slices in there and take out my anger and its gets chopped very easily into the container below.  I throw salad dressing over everything in the container and eat as is.  Easy to clean especially with the included tools.  Just make sure you clean after every use or at least rinse off all the food.  Otherwise might be pretty annoying to clean.  I didn't find the extra tools useful at all.

title: Verified Purchase
content: When using my chopper was surprised at how hard it was to get my vegetables to go through. Even with sharp blades, it was a struggle. I even cut my vegetables down, still had a hard time and I was only doing onions that were sliced in half. I cut the onions even thinner, still has a hard time. I was using the one with smaller blades. When cleaning with the brushes, I could still see onions stuck to the blades. Ended up using the tip of a knife to get stuck onion off blades. I‚Äôll let it soak in hot water next time. I didn‚Äôt want to dull the blades by letting it soak in water for to long. Another thing that was disappointing was the loud sound it makes once the vegetables cut through. BAM, so loud, I was scared I broke the thing. I saw a video of one purchaser put a whole onion through it, no loud sound once the whole onion went through. What I‚Äôm I doing wrong ? Things I like about the chopper is that it cuts the very in perfect little cube size, all the same size. I like it has a container that the vegetables fall into. I wanted so bad to give a five star review, but I can‚Äôt because of the encounters I experienced. Hopefully over time in using it, it will get better and I‚Äôll get the hand of it
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2024

title: Great chopper!
content: I just prepped 3/4 lb baby carrots and a large red onion in under 4 minutes, and that includes peeling the onion and rough chopping into quarters. Took me less than 2 minutes to clean. Only other thing I used was a knife to cut the onion. Simple to use (although for harder things like carrots you'll need to hit it or have enough muscle to squeeze it down, but I was doing 4 baby carrots at a time). Changing blades couldn't be easier. Clean up is a breeze with the tools provided. No muss, no fuss, no cutting board or 20 minutes of cutting. And I can store the veggies in the container until needed. Fullstar also has covers for the catch bowl and I think I'll purchase them in the future. The only reason I gave a 4 out of 5 is one, I can't give 4.5 stars. Second, it's a shame that it doesn't come with a slicing blade, like if you want to slice celery or thin strips of apple or sweet potato for drying or potato for au gratan potatos. The egg slicer will only reliably slice soft things like an egg or a ripe avocado. Had it come with that slicing blade, the review would have been 5.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I bought the Fullstar 8 in 1 vegetable chopper:  I have now used the product a total of one time only, just once so far, but that was enough to realize that it's really a big time saver.  Sure, I could have done all of my potato dicing by hand, but this really made things a whole lot faster and easier, and that faster includes the little bit of clean-up time to hand wash the few pieces I used.

title: Very, very sharp!
content: Use CAUTION.  I cut my finger on the blades when I tried to remove an onion that was stuck so please be very careful.  I now have a deep cut on the end of my finger that will take time to heal as I will probably keep bumping it by accident.  This is not the fault of the manufacturer.  They include a warning that the blades are sharp.  I found that the chopper required small pieces of onion and apple.  It was too difficult for me to force the top down otherwise.  So I still had a lot of cutting to do.  In addition it takes time to clean and repack all the parts, so I am not sure how much I will use it.  It does make very uniform pieces, which is good for apple fritters.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2024

title: works excellent for chipping onions or anything you need diced
content: Love this chopper! I thought I was going to blow this off as some very dull little blade that I would be fighting with and spend more time cleaning it than it would take me to actually chop it myself, but I was wrong. Blades are very sharp and work very well to make short work of any dicing. As a colorguard school graduate, I always find gadgets like these is a waste of money, but I was proven very wrong. I was able to chop enough hashbrowns for our entire family of six in a matter of minutes. You can‚Äôt put the items in hole, there is some prep you need to do ahead of time, but even with that it makes it go much faster being able to just lay large slices inside and whack the top. That is the big key, you can‚Äôt just press you have to actually hit it! The variety of other items on the other hand feel like they‚Äôre a waste of plastic. Maybe other people will find a use for them, but I have barely even looked at them outside of the package. The extra cleaning brush is very useful for getting in between the little grooves to get bits of food out when washing and along the top tongues of the  Compression flap. The storage capacity is great, but if you are doing a high volume, we will need to empty it occasionally into a larger bowl, which isn‚Äôt a big deal. I do wish there was a size in between the very large chopper size and the small diced one.  They may offer a separate one, but I have not looked yet. Hopefully they come out with maybe a micro plane option as well so you can shave things like cabbage, brussels sprouts etc..
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2024

title: Chopped summer squash, onions, bell peppers, fennel bulb
content: I decided to treat myself to a vegetable chopper as I am working on adding more vegetables to my diet.  Prime Days had the 4 blade Fullstar Vegetable Chopper at a price almost half off the usual price.  So I splurged.  Chopping all the vegetables I eat takes a lot of time but not with the chopper. As soon as the chopper arrived I brought out my vegetables to try it out.  I used the larger holes for all the above.  Summer squash and bell peppers were so easy, onions needed to be sliced a little thinner before cutting, the fennel bulb was tough but actually not too bad.  Cleanup was a breeze with the provided tools. My only caveat is that 4 blade unit does not include a way to slice.  I haven't used the included spiralizer, it's not something I probably will use and would rather have the mandolin slicer instead.

title: Use it everyday
content: I really like using this because it makes chopping up my veggies so much easier and faster. I only use one of the blade attachments, but that one I've been using works great. It's actually kind of difficult to clean though. I wash it by hand and the food often gets trapped in the edges of the blade and the top part of the chopper so I always go in with a knife or something flat to get the food out and then wash with soap. I've never tried putting it in a dishwasher, so I don't know if that would work better.
